title.narrative: 5. COMMUNICATION FOR BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL NORMS CHANGES

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Different Communication for Development strategies were used in synergy to raise awareness of the population, parents, community leaders, and children and adolescents on child protection. The main strategies used were community engagement, capacity building of partners, communication for behavioural change through media and proximity communication such as radio. Through these strategies, 3,120,687 people (comprising 1,040,229 women, 1,300,286 men and 780,172 children) in seven regions have strengthened their knowledge on child protection issues. The C4D interventions especially contributed to programmes such as ending child marriage, elimination of female genital mutilation and violence against children, and universal birth registration. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020
